results.title: Ciao Federico!
results.brief_description: This is a hour spent in the company of Frederico Fellini, unarguably one of cinema’s greatest figures. American filmmaker Bachmann was given unequalled access to the Maestro and his medium, following Fellini around during the shooting of “Satirycon”. Fellini displays all the attributes for which he was famous; he cajoles, implores, abuses and torments his cast and crew, behaves one minute like a tyrant and the next like a baby, displays grace and charm, and on occasions a touch of genius. It offers a fascinating portrait of Fellini at work.

results.title: Christmas classics. Vol. 02
results.brief_description: A compilation of 6 classic Christmas tales including. “Christmas comes but once a year” (dir. Dave Fleischer): When children in an orphanage wake on Christmas day to find they are left with a miserable collection of presents it’s up to the inventive Professor Grampy to restore their faith in Christmas. “Hector’s hectic life” (dir. Bill Tytla): Hector is trying so hard to be a good little puppy before Santa arrives but when he has to look after three mischievous puppies it’s going to be harder than he thought. “Snow foolin’” (dir. I Sparber): The forest animals make the most of the first winter snow as they ski, skate, build snowmen and have snowball fights. “Jack Frost”: A young grizzly bear decides he won’t hibernate for winter but the task proves harder than he thought and Jack Frost has to save him from an uncertain fate. “Little drummer boy” (prod., dirs. Arthur Rankin Jnr., Jules Bass): Greer Garson narrates this classic tale, presented in wonderful puppetry. The Little Drummer Boy, blessed with a special gift follows the Three Kings to Bethlehem. Features the voices of the Vienna Boys Choir. “Christmas through the ages” (dir. Milan Herzog): An entertaining history of the legends and customs of Christmas throughout the world.

results.title: Christmas cake
results.creator_credit: David Grusovin, Katey Grusovin, Sally Browning and Emerald Films
results.brief_description: The story of two elderly sisters-in-law, Mollie and Jessie Brereton who have lived together most of their adult lives. Through necessity rather than choice, for the most part. Each year they make a Christmas Cake for their families. This is a very touching portrait of love, hate, compromise and companionship, lovingly compiled by two grandchildren of the ladies.

results.title: Christmas classics. -Volume 1
results.brief_description: This tape features 5 classic Christmas tales: THE LITTLEST ANGEL; a little angel who can’t stay out of trouble consults the gates of heaven for advice. His wish is granted and the angel becomes the inspiration of Jesus, based on the story by Charles Tazewell; SILENT NIGHT; a special story about how this famous carol came to be written in Oberndorf, Germany in the late nineteenth century, produced by William Hanna and Joseph Barbera; RUDOLPH THE RED-NOSED REINDEER; Rudolph’s shiny nose helps save the day one fateful Christmas, directed by Max Fleischer; SOMEWHERE IN DREAMLAND; two poor children dream of the riches of Christmas to escape the sombre Christmas morning poverty has given them. A surprise awaits them courtesy of some kind shop keepers, directed by Dave Fleischer; SANTA’S SURPRISE; an international group of children set out to find what Santa does after he’s delivered all the presents, directed by Seymour Kneitel. No other production details available.

results.title: Christ Is Risen
results.creator_credit: William Canning, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Focuses on the Easter service in the Russian Orthodox Church of St Peter and St Paul in Montreal. The depth of the emotion touched by this ancient ceremony is reflected in the film. Filmed in a shadowy, taper-lit space, sonorous with chanting voices, and coloured with occasional views of icons and frescos, the film shows an absorbing religious experience.

results.title: Chocolat [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Claire Denis, Alain Belmondo, Gerald Crosnier, Cerito Films, La Sept and Oceania Produzioni Internazionali Cinematografiche
results.brief_description: Memories of a childhood in a remote part of the French Cameroons provides the basis for this subtle, partly autobiographical, portrait of a colonial society. France (a surrogate for the filmmaker), revisiting the Cameroons, flashes back to scenes of her youth when her father was a French colonial official. The precarious equilibrium of their household (the mother is attracted to a young black servant) is disturbed by the sudden arrival of a group of outsiders, both European and African, after the forced landing of their plane nearby. The sharpness of the observation and the performances - each of the outsiders represents a different perspective on Africa - prevents the film from sliding into easy nostalgia for a time and way of life long since past. Cast: Isaach de Bankole, Giulia Boschi, Francois Cluzet, Jean-Claude Adelin. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Chip Carving
results.brief_description: Chip carving is a wonderfully direct and simple way to decorate furniture, cabinets, boxes and plaques. Discusses the basics: how to approach design, sharpen the knife, hold a consistent angle and use it to carve four different borders, a rosette and a free form.

results.title: Chopper [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Dominik, Michele Bennett and Palace Films
results.brief_description: This AFI award winning film is based on the life of Mark Brandon - “Chopper” - Read, a notorious Australian criminal who became a best selling author, publishing 9 books of his life and times as a key stand man in Melbourne’s underworld. Eric Bana plays Chopper following his conviction for abducting a judge who was proceeding over the case of his best friend, Jimmy Loughnan (Simon Lyndon). Read ends up serving a 16 year sentence for his efforts, during which he shares a cell with Jimmy and has to contend with Keithy George (David Field), a crime boss who runs the prison. After an attack of violence instigated by Chopper, he kills Keithy and finds himself the target of numerous prisoners wishing revenge on him. As he sees it, the only way to escape the notorious H division is to get his friend to chop his ears off so that he can be transferred to another prison. Eight years later, Chopper is released and finds himself battling his own personal demons and psychotic episodes to try and adjust to outside life. All he can focus on is seeking revenge on arch enemy Neville Bartos (Vince Colosimo) and looking out for his girlfriend, Tanya (Kate Beahan). This special edition includes deleted scenes, theatrical trailer and footage of director Andrew Dominik and Eric Bana’s visit to Chopper in Tasmania while researching the film.
